title: brooklyn dodgers/New york giants
content:
Are these custom? Is there anything out there similar?

Thanks

author: samiam1973

comments.content:
This category of fonts is known as “Tuscan.” A search at MyFonts using that keyword yields some potentially useful options:

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tuscan](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125085942/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tuscan)

Marc,  
Out of idle curiousity, do you know why that style is called Tuscan?  
Tim

The letter style we call Tuscan goes back to the 3rd Century Rome at least, according to Rob Roy Kelly in “American Wood Type.” He also says that it probably originated with the Greeks. It’s named after Tuscany where, presumably, one would find a lot of examples of this style of letter. It’s not clear if the name was used before the 19th Century when the style became wildly popular for display typefaces.

OK. does any one know one that is close to those two?

Thanks again.

‘ [Dekoria](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125085942/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1129&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=FOT0000070)’, _by [Stefan Claudius](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Stefan%20Claudius) / Fountain_, _may be a nice alternate_..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125085942/http:/www.formlos.net/)
